Generation I.Red: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.
Generation I.Yellow: If a major power outage occurs, it is certain that this Pok é mon has eaten electricity at a power plant.
Generation I.Stadium: Appear in power plants in search of electricity. They are said to cause major blackouts if they disappear.

Generation II.Gold: Electricity runs across the surface of its body. In darkness, its entire body glows a whitish-blue.
Generation II.Silver: Its body constantly discharges electricity. Getting close to it will make your hair stand on end.
Generation II.Crystal: When two Electabuzz touch, they control the electric currents to communicate their feelings.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Electricity runs across the surface of its body. In darkness, its entire body glows a whitish-blue. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Its body constantly discharges electricity. Getting close to it will make your hair stand on end. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: When a storm arrives, gangs of this Pok é mon compete with each other to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning bolts. Some towns use Electabuzz in place of lightning rods.
Generation III.Sapphire: When a storm arrives, gangs of this Pok é mon compete with each other to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning bolts. Some towns use Electabuzz in place of lightning rods.
Generation III.Emerald: When a storm approaches, it competes with others to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning. Some towns use Electabuzz in place of lightning rods.
Generation III.FireRed: It loves to feed on strong electricity. It occasionally appears around large power plants and so on.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.

Generation IV.Diamond: Half of all blackouts occur when this Pokémon appears at power plants and eats electricity.
Generation IV.Pearl: Half of all blackouts occur when this Pokémon appears at power plants and eats electricity.
Generation IV.Platinum: It windmills its arms to slightly boost its punches. Foes have been known to escape in the meantime.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Electricity runs across the surface of its body. In darkness, its entire body glows a whitish-blue.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Its body constantly discharges electricity. Getting close to it will make your hair stand on end.

Generation V.Black: It windmills its arms to slightly boost its punches. Foes have been known to escape in the meantime.
Generation V.White: It windmills its arms to slightly boost its punches. Foes have been known to escape in the meantime.
Generation V.Black 2: Research is progressing on storing lightning in Electabuzz so this energy can be used at any time.
Generation V.White 2: Research is progressing on storing lightning in Electabuzz so this energy can be used at any time.

Generation VI.X: Electricity runs across the surface of its body. In darkness, its entire body glows a whitish blue.
Generation VI.Y: It loves to feed on strong electricity. It occasionally appears around large power plants and so on.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: When a storm arrives, gangs of this Pokémon compete with each other to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning bolts. Some towns use Electabuzz in place of lightning rods.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: When a storm arrives, gangs of this Pokémon compete with each other to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning bolts. Some towns use Electabuzz in place of lightning rods.

Generation VII.Sun: Half of all sudden blackouts are caused by Electabuzz gathering at electric power plants and gobbling up electricity.
Generation VII.Moon: Electricity leaks from it in amounts far greater than the amount of electricity it eats.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Electricity permeates its body. It swings its arms round and round to charge up electricity before unleashing a punch.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: While it's often blamed for power outages, the truth is the cause of outages is more often an error on the part of the electric company.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: If a major power outage occurs, it is certain that this Pokémon has eaten electricity at a power plant.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: If a major power outage occurs, it is certain that this Pokémon has eaten electricity at a power plant.

Generation VIII.Sword: Many power plants keep Ground-type Pokémon around as a defense against Electabuzz that come seeking electricity.
Generation VIII.Shield: With the coming of a storm, many of these Pokémon will gather under tall trees and sit there waiting for lightning to strike.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Half of all blackouts occur when this Pokémon appears at power plants and eats electricity.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Half of all blackouts occur when this Pokémon appears at power plants and eats electricity.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Feeds on electrical energy. During sudden showers beneath looming thunderclouds, one can observe Electabuzz scaling tall trees, where the Pokémon will then wait for lightning to strike.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Its body constantly discharges electricity. Getting close to it will make your hair stand on end.
Generation IX.Violet: Research is progressing on storing lightning in Electabuzz so this energy can be used at any time.

Generation IV.HeartGold: Route 10 Safari Zone (Forest with 4 Peak points)
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Route 10 Safari Zone (Forest with 4 Peak points)

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Blush Mountain , Mount Hokulani ( SOS Battle )
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Blush Mountain , Mount Hokulani ( SOS Battle )
